pageTitle: Redlands Touring Caravan & Camping Park, Haverfordwest, Pembrokeshire - Pitchup.com
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {31693=Did not match up to the view shown on your web site. 10 Sep 2014, 24614=Excellent sites, clean, tidy and good value 8 Apr 2015, 28025=Mrs Swabey 7 Apr 2015, 42804=New Hardstandings added in 2010. Access via a "B" road which narrows a couple of times to go over bridges etc. We regularly welcome american RV's so access is considered fine., 38660=Lovely site with beautiful views.Ideal if walking the coastal path. 3 Apr 2010, 41783=Remote location 7 Mar 2010, 21324=Good site, quiet location 9 Jun 2015, 35078=Traditional campsite, lovely location and outlook.Best ever holiday! 17 Sep 2014}
textBeforeTable: Water quality at nearby bathing waters If you are looking for a more active pastime then you are within easy distance of fishing, beach horse riding, surfing and sailing. The park is conveniently placed for visiting St David's Catherdral, Tenby, the puffins of Skomer Island and all of the wonderful attractions that Pembrokeshire has to offer such as castles, Oakwood Theme Park and bird sanctuaries. We are located close to ferries to Ireland so day trips across to the Emerald Isle are possible. Situated just 1.5 miles from the pretty coastal village of Little Haven with three excellent pubs and a seaside café. You will be spoilt for choice with many sandy beaches nearby and the area is ideal for walkers as the famous Pembrokeshire National Coastal Path is only one mile away. ✓ English Languages spoken   Tourist board rating 30 30 19 Site type We also have a small shop on site plus laundry facilities and deep freezers for guests to use. The park has large pitches and is specifically run for touring caravans, motorhomes and tents.
textAfterTable: Data source: European Environment Agency Local pubs Just 20 metres from Pembrokeshire Coast Path; neat stripped-stone bar and linked carpeted dining area, log fire, interesting well in back corner grotto thought to be partly Roman, Banks's, Marstons and a guest, enjoyable bar food; background music and TV; children welcome, dogs in bar, seats in sheltered suntrap terrace garden across road, two bedrooms, open all day summer St Brides Inn Little Haven 1.3 mi Welcoming pub well placed by green looking over sandy bay (lovely sunsets), enjoyable food inc pizzas and local fish, Marstons ales, good choice of wines by the glass, tea and cafetière coffee, bare-boards bar and carpeted dining area with big oak tables, beams, some stripped stone, castle prints, pool in back area; children welcome, front picnic-sets, open 10.30am to midnight Castle Inn Little Haven 1.4 mi
